title: Graceful Greys: Women Around The World Are Flaunting Their Natural Grey Hair & It's Empowering
text:
People can get grey hair before growing ‘old’ for a multitude of reasons. Stress is one of the major reasons millennials are going grey; some people just have a condition. Instead of being embarrassed about or covering the grey, women around the world are embracing them as a part of their personalities.

This has sort of become a global movement where the women embracing their silver locks are displaying and flaunting them with pride. The idea is to show that there are more important things in life than to match society’s idea of beauty standards, and undyed hair are beautiful and empowering.

Instagram

This is a 27-year-old, who shared that she started going grey when she was 17. She said on social media that she never dyed her hair as the grey is part of her identity.

Another person on the grombre community page said, that her hair had been going grey for a year and she was beginning to like the look more and more. She even said that she got complimented by people for finding 'such a good dye'.

Instagram

Another person wrote on Instagram, 'I love my hair. I have watched in fascination as the silver slowly weaves through the dark'.

Instagram

Deb Pincket only recently stopped dying her hair. Before this she spent 19 years of her life going to the salon to get her hair done. She has now decided to embrace what’s natural.

The trend is indeed empowering, motivating us all to embrace our natural selves. After all, who says you can't grey gracefully?
